summary: The COVID-19 pandemic had a profound impact on air travel. Department of Transportation statistics show passenger traffic dropped 60% in 2020, sending ripple effects throughout the U.S. commercial aviation industry. We testified about the industry's response to the downturn, which included its use of federal help—such as payroll support—and cutting costs. title: COVID-19 Pandemic: Preliminary Observations on Efforts toward and Factors Affecting the Aviation Industry's Recovery
